contentrichtext.text: {{other uses|Nitel (disambiguation)}} {| class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="4" style="float: right; margin: 0 0 1em 1em; width: 20em; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%; clear: right;" |+ <span style="font-size:140%;">'''Nigerian Telecommunications (NITEL)'''</span> |- |style= align="center" colspan="2"| [[Image:NitelLogo.JPG|70px]] |- |'''Established:'''|| |- |'''[[Director General]]:'''||[[Engineer Abubakar Nahuce]] |- |'''[[Headquarters]]:'''|| [[Abuja]], [[Nigeria]] |- |} Nigerian Telecommunications Limited, or '''NITEL''', is the principal [[telecommunications]] company in [[Nigeria]], and was owned by the government of Nigeria until it was sold to [[Mtel]] by the [[Bureau of Public Enterprises]] (BPE). The [[mobile phone|mobile telecommunications]] arm of Nitel, Nitel is responsible for all wired telecommunications in Nigeria. In February 2008 a report by [[BBC News]] says that the Nigerian government assumes the transnational corporation did not improve performance of NITEL and therefore stopped privatization in favour of [[Transcorp]]. Nigerians are frustrated that Nitel has failed to deliver impeccable services that can compare with other networks of the globe. They are not too optimistic that the present Nigerian Government can do this despite the president's promise of improved services by 2009. Looking from 1958 to the arrival of Global Satellite system communication (GSM) in Nigeria; NITEL was able to provide 450,000 susbscriber lines for a population of 120 million.<ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/7251154.stm</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}}<!--added above categories/infobox footers by script-assisted edit--> [[Category:Telecommunications companies of Nigeria]] {{telecom-company-stub}} {{Nigeria-company-stub}}
